Learn more about using Distill for R Markdown at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.

articles.title: Agreement between SpHb and Coulter Hb
articles.contents:
Contents
Abstract
Background
Objective
Methodology


Abstract
Background
Critical care relies heavily on accurate and timely monitoring of a patient’s hemoglobin (Hb) levels to guide treatment decisions. Point of care hemoglobin (SpHb) measurement devices have gained popularity due to their non-invasive nature and ability to provide real-time Hb values, potentially reducing the need for frequent blood draws. However, the accuracy and agreement of SpHb measurements with traditional Coulter Hb measurements remain subjects of concern and investigation.
Objective
The objective of this study is to assess and establish the agreement between SpHb measurements and Coulter Hb measurements in critically ill patients.
Methodology
Study Design
This was a prospective observational study conducted in the intensive care unit (ICU) of Bigsby Hospital over a period of 12 months.
Participants
A total of 200 critically ill adult patients were enrolled in the study. Patients requiring continuous Hb monitoring as part of their clinical management were recruited.
Measurements
SpHb measurements were obtained using Pront7 co-oximeter, while Coulter Hb measurements were performed simultaneously using standard laboratory methods.
Statistical Analysis
Bland-Altman analysis was used to assess the agreement between SpHb and Coulter Hb measurements. This included calculation of bias, limits of agreement, and generation of Bland-Altman plots.

articles.title: Why KJACCM?
articles.contents:
Contents
Background
Benefit from Peer Reviewed Medical Publishing
Focus on Reproduceable Research


Background
Since 2015, KJACCM has worked with authors to publish locally generated evidence. This has been used to advance science in Anesthesiology and Critical Care Medicine.
Benefit from Peer Reviewed Medical Publishing
With a commitment to publishing high quality research, KJACCM has assembled one of the most trusted and authoritative journals in Anesthesiology and Critical Care Medicine both for experienced practitioners and trainees. Our unbiased peer-review editorial process sets the standard for medical publishing. Your manuscript will benefit from careful attention of experienced editors, reviewers, statistical and data science experts, graphics and production personnel.
Focus on Reproduceable Research
Apart from publishing processed articles, domain practitioners and scientits are keen on publishing the collected data too. This may be of benefit to the upcoming scientist on how well one can collect, clean and store data. Additionally, the code and statistical methods that were used to arrive at specific conclusions will be published.
